meanings.sent1: The magnet will cleave to the metal surface.
meanings.sent2: I cleave to my beliefs even in difficult times.
meanings.sent3: The sticker cleaved to the paper with surprising strength.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship cleaved through all obstacles.
meanings.sent5: Her words cleaved to my heart, leaving a lasting impact.

meanings.definition: To split or divide by or as if by a cutting blow
meanings.sent1: The lumberjack used an axe to cleave the log in half.
meanings.sent2: The sword was able to cleave through the enemy's armor.
meanings.sent3: With one swift motion, he cleaved the watermelon perfectly.
meanings.sent4: The storm cleaved the tree in two, blocking the road.
meanings.sent5: His powerful kick cleaved the soccer ball into the goal.

meanings.definition: To penetrate or pass through something by or as if by cutting
meanings.sent1: The arrow cleaved through the air towards its target.
meanings.sent2: The drill can cleave through even the toughest materials.
meanings.sent3: She cleaved through the crowd to reach the front of the line.
meanings.sent4: His words cleaved through her defenses, revealing the truth.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight cleaved through the darkness, illuminating the room.
